answers.answer: I wild would set an appt with your dr to test for preclampisaa bcoz that is serious condition if left untreated you can go into premature birth and even suffer a stroke I heard

If it is hot where you live its probably nothing more than just swelling. Ive had the same problem for a few months now, extreme swelling in my legs, feet and hands. It was painful and nothing helped it. I would ask my dr about it at every appointment, because like you everyone made me worry about preclampsia. He reassured me each that it was not, no protein in my urine and my blood pressure was fine. I am now 37 weeks and up until last week I to was working full time. Now that I am no longer working my swelling has almost completely gone away. Its nice to see my ankles again :)

question: Lately my hands and feet can get really swollen sometimes during the day but mostly at night and I think it's b/c I work long days and think swelling is normal. It always goes away by morning but lately my hands are always swollen and everyone around thinks it's signs of preeclampsia...is this something toworry or normal because I work a lot...I'm 36 weeks, thanks for any input!!!! :)
title: swollen..preeclampsia!?
